#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk docker
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: docker bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: Docker is an open source engine that automates the deployment of any application as a lightweight, portable, self-sufficient container that will run virtually anywhere. The docker packages have been upgraded to upstream version 1.8.2, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1265810) This update also fixes the following bugs: Setting up the DATA_SIZE option in the /etc/sysconfig/docker-storage-setup file failed with an error when trying to specify a size with either megabytes or gigabytes (for example DATA_SIZE=5G). This bug has been fixed and now using DATA_SIZE passes the correct string to LVM and sets up the volumes successfully. (BZ#1255488) Previously, the default SELinux policies prevented the Performance Co-Pilot (PCP) suite of tools from working correctly with containers. This update adds SELinux rules for docker policies shipped with the docker-selinux package and PCP services now work correctly for containers. (BZ#1261811) Users of docker are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
